title: RIDE! Wins ESA PUSH Contract to Offer Ariane 6 Launch Capacity
summary:
French launch aggregator RIDE! has won an ESA contract to offer its services free of charge to customers interested in launching payloads aboard the maiden Ariane 6 flight in 2024. The contract is part of the agency’s Programme for Userbase Enhancement (PUSH), which aims to provide a platform for companies that offer “groundbreaking space-related products […]
The post RIDE! Wins ESA PUSH Contract to Offer Ariane 6 Launch Capacity appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Daily Telescope: Two galaxies colliding 300 million light-years from Earth
summary: "I have wanted to image these for some time."

title: Quantum Space reveals plan for Scout-1 satellite and Sentry mission
summary: Quantum Space plans to launch Scout-1, the space infrastructure and services company’s first satellite, no earlier than March 2024 on a SpaceX Transporter rideshare flight.

title: Intuitive Machines planning up to three lunar lander missions in 2024
summary: As Intuitive Machines prepares for the launch of its first lunar lander mission, the company says it’s planning for up to three lander launches in 2024.

title: HyImpulse Inches Closer to Maiden SR75 Flight
summary:
German launch startup HyImpulse Technologies has announced the successful completion of the assembly and integration of its first SR75 launch vehicle. The HyImpulse SR75 is a one-stage suborbital rocket capable of carrying payloads of up to 250 kilograms to a maximum altitude of 200 kilometres. The vehicle is powered by the company’s HyPLOX-75 hybrid rocket […]
The post HyImpulse Inches Closer to Maiden SR75 Flight appeared first on European Spaceflight.
